subject: Leadership
title: Porter's Five Forces
description: Learn Porter's Five Forces in one minute.

hook.text: Airlines make billions in revenue but razor-thin profits. Coffee shops with tiny revenues are far more profitable. Why?

buildup.text: Porter identified five forces shaping industry profit: rivalry, new entrants, substitutes, buyer power, supplier power.

discovery.text: Strong forces compress profits. Airlines face fierce rivalry, powerful buyers, and commodity substitutes. Structural.

twist.text: Strategy isn't just competing within your industryâ€”it's choosing industries and positions where the forces favor you.

climax.text: Leaders use Five Forces to assess where to compete and how to position their organization for structural advantage.

punchline.text: Don't just play the game. Choose a game you can win.
